snippet: Jack Conway, the attorney general of Kentucky, became the latest in a group of Democratic state prosecutors to refuse to defend laws prohibiting gay marriage.
abstract: Kentucky Atty Gen Jack Conway becomes latest in group of Democratic state prosecutors to refuse to defend laws prohibiting gay marriage; Gov Steven L Beshear says state plans to hire outside lawyer to defend same-sex marriage ban following judge's ruling striking down part of ban, saying he prefers 'orderly process' of appeals leading to ultimate resolution by Supreme Court.
lead_paragraph: Jack Conway, the attorney general of Kentucky, became the latest in a group of Democratic state prosecutors to refuse to defend laws prohibiting gay marriage.

headline.main: Kentucky Law Official Will Not Defend Ban on Same-Sex Marriage
headline.print_headline: Kentucky Law Official Will Not Defend Ban on Same-Sex Marriage

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
